--- title: "Beyond Experimentation" date: "March 21, 2024" format: html --- ## Overview We use experiments to understand whether a policy would work. We usually care about whether said policy works **outside** of the experimental setting. Experiments alone do not answer that question. Which opens a conversation on the scope and limitations of using experiments to inform policy-making. The lab illustrates these ideas by giving you the chance to write your own design based on an application of your choosing. ## Reading - {{< fa book >}} [RD section 23](https://book.declaredesign.org/lifecycle/integration.html) - {{< fa file-lines >}} Deaton, Angus, and Nancy Cartwright. 2018.
